thread.title: Tech notches first 2016 hoops commit in point guard Keon Clergeot
thread.title_full: Texas Tech notches first 2016 hoops commit in point guard Keon Clergeot | Dallas Morning News

author: EJ Holland
title: Tech notches first 2016 hoops commit in point guard Keon Clergeot
text:
The focus in Lubbock is on Kliff Kingsbury and the football program.
But Tubby Smith and the Texas Tech basketball staff are working hard on the recruiting trail and reeled in a commitment from Auburndale (Fla.) point guard Keon Clergeot on Tuesday evening.
He announced his decision via Twitter.
ðŸ”´âš«ï¸ðŸ”«Texas Tech University!! âš«ï¸ðŸ”´ðŸ”« #GunsUp pic.twitter.com/N50sxpjuo6
— â„¢StayHumbleKeâœ¨ (@Keonhumble) October 13, 2015 Clergeot's decision comes just five days after he made an official visit to Texas Tech. He chose the Red Raiders over offers from Stephen F. Austin, Hofstra, Louisiana Tech, South Alabama, VCU and others.
The 6-foot-1, 160-pounder is currently unranked.
Clergeot is Texas Tech's first basketball commit in the 2016 class.
